div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Columbia George for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. FEB 24 1906. A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the matter of the application of Columbia George for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Motion
Based upon the affidavit of R J Slater filled herewith the above named Petitioner moves this honorable court permitting him to prosecute this proceeding as a poor person without the payment of costs.
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the matter of the application of Columbia George for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
State of Washington, County of King

I, R J Slater, being first duly sworn, say: That I am attorney for the above named Petitioner; that I am personally acquainted with him, and am personally acquainted with his financial circumstances; that he is an allottee on Umatilla Reservation in the State of Oregon, of One Hundred Sixty (160) acres of land, but since he has been confined to the Penitentiary the Untied States authorities have refused to allow him to transact any business concerning the same, and he has received no benefits therefrom, and he is absolutely impecunious and has no money nor property of any kind and no means whereby he can produce any funds; that I am acting as his attorney without any compensation excepting what I may be able to hereafter obtain should he be set at liberty and restored to his rights upon said Umatila Indian Reservation; that there is no one connected with this case or interested in the said Petitioner who has any funds or property, for which reason I make this affidivit and ask the Court for an order that this matter may be prosecuted without the payment of costs.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24th day of February, 1906
James J. McCafferty, Notary Public in and for said County and State residing at Seattle, said County
